intro: Rytigynia monantha var. monantha, commonly known as the white-flowered rytigynia, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous shrub with opposite, ovate leaves that are often glandular-dotted. Its flowers are white or pale yellow, with five petals and a prominent yellow stamen, making it visually distinctive. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
